There are a wide variety of methods for cleansing your body, along with many different levels of intensity. However, the simplest and single most important step you can take to help your body flush out toxins is to drink more water. Adding more movement to your daily routine can also help increase your circulation and release endorphins, which act as positive mood boosters. Cleanses Here are some examples of different types of internal cleanses. Be sure to consult with your health professional before starting a cleansing regimen. The Master Cleanse This is a simple and fairly easy liquid cleanse that you can do for up to 7-10 days: - ½ fresh squeezed lemon - 8 oz. of distilled water - 1-2 tablespoons of grade B maple syrup or [Young Living Blue Agave](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/blue-agave-natural-sweetener) - A pinch of cayenne pepper Mix and drink 6-12 glasses daily. Vital Life Juice Recipe Young Living Founder and CEO D. Gary Young created this recipe over 25 years ago to provide concentrated nutrients. - 3 ounces freshly sliced beet - 1 oz. freshly sliced carrot - 1 oz. freshly sliced celery - 1/3 freshly sliced white radish - 1 pinch of ginger - 1/3 potato (optional) Puree all ingredients in a blender and drink ¼-½ cup every 2-3 hours. Grapefruit Juice Recipe This refreshing drink is simple to make and easy to drink throughout the day. - ½ cup freshly squeezed grapefruit juice - 1 quart distilled or purified water - 3 drops [Spearmint Vitality essential oil](https://www.youngliving.com/en_US/products/spearmint-vitality) - 3 drops [Tangerine Vitality essential oil](https://www.youngliving.com/us/en/product/tangerine-vitality) - Young Living Blue Agave to taste Mix ingredients together in a pitcher and store in the refrigerator.
